meanings.sent1: The puppy's actual owner arrived to pick him up.
meanings.sent2: The actual size of the fish was much smaller than the fisherman claimed.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't believe the actual price of the toy car; it was a steal!
meanings.sent4: Her actual smile lit up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The actual sound of the thunderstorm was deafening.

meanings.sent1: The actual time for the meeting is 3 o'clock.
meanings.sent2: I need the actual location of the party to plan my route.
meanings.sent3: The actual weather forecast changed suddenly, making everyone grab their umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: Her actual presence in the room made everyone feel at ease.
meanings.sent5: The actual feeling of excitement filled the air as the concert began.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize the truth or accuracy of a statement.
meanings.sent1: She actually finished her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: I actually saw a shooting star last night.
meanings.sent3: He actually thought he could beat me in a race!
meanings.sent4: The news actually surprised me; I didn't expect that at all.
meanings.sent5: I actually felt the ground shake during the earthquake.
